intro: Schwenckia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed schwenckia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive, recurved shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Schwenckia angustifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
